#Text=James F. McGrath
#Text=James
#Text=Frank
#Text=McGrath

#Text=is the Clarence L. Goodwin Chair in New Testament Language and Literature [ 2 ] at Butler University [ 3 ] and is a known for his work on Early Christianity , Mandaean Studies , criticism of the Christ myth theory , and the analysis of religion in science fiction . [ 4 ]
#Text=He received his Ph.D. from Durham University in 1998 . [ 5 ]
#Text=Biography
#Text=James McGrath earned his diploma in religious studies ( with distinction ) from the University of Cambridge in 1993 .
#Text=He went on to receive his Bachelor of Divinity from the University of London , in which he was awarded Second Class , First Degree honors in 1995 .
#Text=He completed his Doctor of Philosophy at the University of Durham in 1998 , under the supervision of James D. G. Dunn . [ 6 ]

#Text=He has served as assistant professor of New Testament at Emmanuel University and the University of Oradea ( 1998-2001 ) , an adjunct professor at Biblical Theological Seminary and Alliance Theological Seminary ( 2001-2002 ) , and professor of Religion at Butler University ( 2002 – present ) . [ 7 ]
#Text=In 2010 , he was appointed the Clarence L. Goodwin Chair of New Testament Language and Literature . [ 8 ]
#Text=McGrath is also the creator of Canon : The Card Game . [ 9 ]
